text: William Haade (March 2, 1903 - November 15, 1966) was an American film actor. He appeared in more than 250 films between 1937 and 1957. He was born in New York City, and died in Los Angeles, California. Haade was a construction boss until he began acting, appearing in Iron Men (1936) on Broadway. A technical advisor to Norman Bel Geddes recommend Haade to his boss, who sought someone unknown for the play's lead. ==Selected filmography== * Kid Galahad (1937) - Chuck McGraw * Telephone Operator (1937) - Heaver * Missing Witnesses (1937) - Emmet White * The Invisible Menace (1938) - Pvt.
